metadata.name: Is this role being posted for the immigration team?

title: Facilities Tech II
content:
Our Opportunity: 
Chewy is currently recruiting for a Facilities and Maintenance Technician II at our Fulfillment Center in Wilkes-Barre, PA. You will have the opportunity to apply your unique experience to support the fast-paced operations of our dynamic fulfillment center environment.  Additionally, you will develop new and valuable skills and experience in the growing world of e-commerce fulfillment operations.  
This position is responsible for a wide variety of facilities, maintenance, and utilities requirements across a large fulfillment center.   
What you'll do: 

You will perform maintenance and repair, housekeeping and plumbing, metal fabrication and carpentry to support our fast-paced fulfillment center operations.  


Ensure that all fulfillment center equipment is operating properly and ensure a safe working environment for all your fulfillment team members. 
Complete periodic and general maintenance tasks throughout the facility - as assigned and according to schedule. 
Perform daily inspections of conveyor systems, shipping, and packing equipment areas. 
Maintain accountability for assigned equipment and associated gear list, reducing loss, damage, and defects to zero. 
Complete repair order and maintain parts usage records. 


Troubleshoot mechanical and electrical problems, you will visually check, test, and evaluate the condition of components, equipment, and circuits. 
Follow company procedures. 

What you’ll need: 

At least 36 months of previous facility maintenance experience 
(Mechanics and Maintainers, Construction and Engineering, Aviation and Transportation Repair) 


Must have electrical experience or understanding 
Must be able to demonstrate electrical knowledge of 24v ac/dc control circuits 
Must be able to demonstrate electrical knowledge of 120v power & control circuits 
Must be able to demonstrate electrical knowledge of 277v-480v power circuits 
Experience using appropriate tools and maintenance equipment. 


Ability to lift 75 pounds and to stand, walk, bend, stoop, twist and turn frequently. 
Requires manual dexterity, overall coordination, and good balance to work at ground level, with the ability to climb and work at elevations up to 35 feet above floor level. 
Interest in math, electricity, shop mechanics, electric motors, and appliances 
Good at solving problems 
Understand potential exposure exists to high voltage current, welding equipment, vehicle and equipment lubricants and solvents. 


Ability to work nights and weekends. 
Experience with fire system and fire alarm electronic devices. 
Ability to read, understand & interpret electrical, pneumatic, & plumbing schematics. 
Experience with conveyor mechanical systems (belts, drives, tracking valves). 
Experience with VFD motor controllers 


Experience with motor starters and control cabinet 
PLC knowledge - input/outputs troubleshooting or some programming 
HVAC - advanced knowledge or experience. 
Communicate preventative maintenance and repair opportunities as well as escalation of resources outside of normal hours when needed, to ensure system performance. 
Can communicate, make sound decisions, work well under pressure 


Recognize problems and repair before breakdown occurs 
Proactive problem solving & mechanical aptitude skills. 
Ability and willingness to train others 
Ability to work nights, weekends and overtime 

 Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you need an accommodation during the application process or to perform these job requirements, or if you need a religious accommodation, please contact CAAR@chewy.com.
 
If you have a question regarding your application, please contact HR@chewy.com.
 
To access Chewy's Customer Privacy Policy, please click here. To access Chewy's California CPRA Job Applicant Privacy Policy, please click here.

questions.description: At Chewy, we define inventory control as ensuring we have the appropriate amounts of stock on hand to meet customer orders efficiently.​
questions.label: Do you have inventory control experience?
Do you have experience driving equipment commonly found in a warehouse environment?

questions.description: At Chewy, we define a reach truck as a narrow-aisle, right-angle stacking truck designed for unit load handling with rack interface. These lift trucks are meant to operate in narrow aisles and are best for storing and retrieving pallets in racks.
questions.label: Do you have reach truck experience?

questions.description: At Chewy, we define cherry picker as a person, or a piece of equipment used to pick and deliver material needed for filling orders from storage.
questions.label: Do you have experience with aerial work platform equipment, commonly known as a “cherry picker”?
Are you willing to drive equipment commonly found in a warehouse environment?

By clicking “Acknowledge/Confirm” on this form, you agree to receive emails, text messages and calls about your potential employment with Chewy, including this job application, interviewing, and onboarding, as well as your relationship with us, by or on behalf of Chewy, including via automated technology and artificial or pre-recorded voice, at the telephone number provided above. Msg & data rates may apply. Subject to our Terms of Use (https://careers.chewy.com/terms)  and Privacy Policy (https://www.chewy.com/app/content/privacy). Opt-out from these messages at any time by replying STOP to any message from us. Texting STOP to one shortcode will not effectuate a stop request for all shortcodes to which you are subscribed.
